entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the eastern Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Additional rainfall totals from 0.50 to 1.00 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. Water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and River in Juneau remain elevated and near bankfull due to previous days heavy rainfall. River levels are expected to drop late Thursday evening as no more heavy precipitation is forecast for the region. People living along the lake and river and any individuals recreating on these water
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH SATURDAY... Additional storm systems will move across Southcentral Alaska through the first half of the weekend. Widespread rain is expected Thursday evening through Friday morning, and again Friday evening into Saturday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS TODAY AND TONIGHT... Multiple rounds of thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rain will be possible this afternoon and tonight across the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness. The main impacts from the storms will be frequent cloud-to-ground lightning and locally heavy

entry.summary: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS POSSIBLE ACROSS EASTERN NORTH DAKOTA... Showers and thunderstorms have developed across eastern North Dakota this afternoon. Conditions are favorable for funnel clouds with any thunderstorm that does develop. These types of funnel clouds are usually short lived, however, they can and occasionally do touch the ground and cause minor damage.

entry.cap:areaDesc: West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes; West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 18 at 3:12PM PDT until August 19 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Hot conditions with temperatures in the mid 80s to mid 90s expected. This will pose a moderate to high risk of heat- related illness. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington. * WHEN...Until midnight PDT tonight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bellevue and Vicinity; Bremerton and Vicinity; East Puget Sound Lowlands; Everett and Vicinity; Hood Canal Area; Lower Chehalis Valley Area; Seattle and Vicinity; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area; Western Skagit County; Western Whatcom County

entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 104. * WHERE...In Washington, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington, Lower Columbia Basin of Washington, Simcoe Highlands, Kittitas Valley and Yakima Valley. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 18 at 1:58PM PDT until August 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 100. * WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 18 at 1:58PM PDT until August 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 98. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
